subject: Languages
title: Australian English: Convicts and Slang
description: A short lesson to help you apply Australian English: Convicts and Slang.

hook.text: Australia's first English speakers were convicts â€” and they invented colorful slang to match.

buildup.text: In 1788, Britain shipped prisoners to Australia. Their London street slang came along.

twist.text: The rising intonation at sentence ends makes every Australian statement sound like a question.

climax.text: Australian English blended convict slang, Aboriginal words, and a unique accent.

punchline.text: A prison colony invented one of the world's friendliest accents.
